page.title: 01The Ouse Washes
page.content: The main features are the new nd old bedford rivers running arallel in a north-easterrly direction. these are man made, and their purpose is to drain the surrounding land which is at sea level. The area between the river is wash land which is liable to flood during the winter, and used for grazing in the summer. the remaining land in the area is used for arable farming, the main crops being wheat, barley and sugar beet. There are few @people living in the area; there is the smll village of Wardy Hill in the South East corner, and isolated farms. Most people make their living from the land which provides high yields. The Bedford rivers are very popular ewith anglers, and are regaded as being among the best fishing waters in the country. The washes also attract a wide varity of migrant wide life.
